title: Lee Sin ( we need to talk)
body: I play a lot of lee sin and after the removal of trackers knife he has become bad I thought oh trackers knife is gone guess ill build sight stone but that's gone too and two wards will not cut it. He was going to be the champ that got me out of silver and he got nerfed feels bad riot can you anything to help us lee mains (i have two other accounts that have lee). {{item:1400}} {{item:1412}} theses items don't really help lee the wards do, please add some sort of compensation.

replies.body: Our Live Gameplay team's exploring Lee Sin buffs to compensate (other than damage buffs). Can't spill the deets yet though!

Perhaps changing his kit is necessary? If he is that reliant on overbearing mobilty through ward hops. If that one aspect dictates whether he's overbearing to deal with/catch or a troll pick... then that spell is near useless in relation to his kit.

Buffing his numbers will only be a bandaid fix as the gaping hole in his mobility will be extremely prevalent and he will feel brutally unfair as he one shots people with little counterplay.

ward hop, Q point blank, ult Q, flash out. The flash cost is irrelevant if the pick he makes wins the fight and then the game. And in this meta, one pick decides everything if it's the right target

You obviously haven't seen people's hate for Lulu top. Also, what does popularity have to do with depth? Are you trying to say that only popular champions can be deep, or that all deep champions are popular?

>The more you write the more you sound like a 'noob'. You don't seem to understand Lee's or Riven's kit because you cannot master them or play against them. Let's end this discussion here thank you.

Haha. Way to evade all the questions and then take your ball home with you. You'd make a great politician. 

Complexity = Skill floor
Depth = Skill ceiling

A champ who is high in complexity but low is depth is bad. They are hard to learn but leave little room for skill expression once mastered.
A champ who is low in complexity but high in depth is good. They're easy to pick up, but have lots of room for skill expression in a variety of ways.

Here's some additional examples.

Riven is a shallow champion because she does one thing and one thing only. Run at the enemy. None of her skills have any way to be applied differently. Pressing her AoE stun will always have the exact same result.

Meanwhile, you have champions like Lee Sin (gasp), Taliyah, and Brand whos kits can create different outcomes depending on how they're used.

Lee Sin's depth is in his R. It always kicks people away from him so positioning is key. Do you want to kick Sion away from your team and into his own, or do you want to sneak in behind Varus and kick him into the waiting arms of your allies?

Taliyah has her AoE Seismic Shove ability. Does she: Use it to forcibly disengage the incoming WW, try to pull someone closer to herself, or toss them sideways into the bush where her jungler is waiting? Three different outcomes all from one single skill.

And then we have Brand. All three of his basic abilities have an extra effect if the enemy is Ablaze. 
Do you want to maximize single target damage via Conflagration-Sear-Pillar, or would you prefer to farm a minion wave via using Sear-Conflagration-Pillar on the canon minion? Perhaps you'd prefer to go for a riskier long range pick instead by going Pillar-Sear-Conflagration against someone hanging back. Three skills that have very different results depending simply on the order in which they are used. 

Meanwhile, Riven can...very slightly nudge someone in a direction depending on where she lands her final Q?

I don't need to play Lee Sin to know that he's one of the only two champions left who can ward hop. Katarina had hers removed in an update and Braum was never even allowed to have it at all.

"If the ally is a champion, both they and Lee Sin are shielded for 2 seconds and Safeguard's cooldown is reduced by 50%."

See this bit right here? Riot had to put it it when ward hopping became too big of an issue for Lee Sin.

Besides, what would the game *really* lose from Lee not being able to ward hop anymore? Those "sick" Insec plays? 

In exchange for removing such power Lee could:

Have his passive scale to 120% bonus attack speed. Thus giving him late game dps.

Sonic Strike is pretty much fine as it always has been. Not too much you could really do here.

Safeguard goes back to having a flat nine, or even seven second, CD so you can use it on minions again. Shield duration is doubled back from two seconds to four.

Tempest reveals invisible champions again.

Lee Sin's Dragon Kick no longer kills its target until after they land. Just like Sion's Roar of the Slayer.


But you'd prefer just keeping your ward hop?

Why are people saying no to non-damage compensation? He is already strong early game to mid game as he should be. The removal of trackers hindered his mobility,(not his damage!) even further which in my opinion should be compensated with a better option which offers greater mobility than before, or atleast more accessible.
